title: Guo Ruilong
text:
Guo Ruilong (; born 1 December 1943) is a <a href="Chinese%20people">Chinese</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach and former footballer.
Playing career.
Born in Kunming, Guo returned to his hometown Beijing in 1946 after the <a href="Second%20Sino-Japanese%20War">Second Sino-Japanese War</a> ended. He began his football career for <a href="Beijing%20Guoan%20F.C.">Beijing Team</a>'s youth team and later graduated to the senior team in 1965. He became a football coach after his retirement in 1975.
Management career.
He served for Inner Mongolia, Beijing Youth and China national youth between 1976 and 1989. In 1990, Guo was appointed as the assistant coach of Beijing Team. On 9 May 2000, Guo joined <a href="Chinese%20Jia-B%20League">Chinese Jia-B League</a> club <a href="Chengdu%20Wuniu">Chengdu Wuniu</a> who struggled in the bottom of league, and helped the club stay in the second tier for the next season. He was sacked by Chengdu on 16 September 2001. He became the assistant coach of top-tier club <a href="Shenzhen%20Ping%27an">Shenzhen Ping'an</a> in December 2001. He was appointed as the team's manager on 17 May 2005 after <a href="Chi%20Shangbin">Chi Shangbin</a>'s dismission. Despite severe financial problems, Guo led Shenzhen to reach the <a href="2005%20AFC%20Champions%20League">2005 AFC Champions League</a> semi-finals before heavily defeated by UAE champions <a href="Al%20Ain%20FC">Al Ain</a> 6–0. He was suddenly sacked on 14 October 2005.
Guo returned to football in December 2007 when he accepted the invitation of <a href="China%20League%20One">China League One</a> club <a href="Anhui%20Jiufang">Anhui Jiufang</a>. On 15 April 2008, he resigned from the team due to "health problems". He joined <a href="China%20League%20Two">China League Two</a> club <a href="Wenzhou%20Provenza">Wenzhou Tomorrow</a> in June 2008. Guo became the manager of League Two club <a href="Hebei%20Zhongji">Hebei Zhongji</a> on 16 August 2013. Although Hebei Zhongji won promotion in the 2013 season by finishing the runners-up in League Two, he didn't extent his contract and left the club.
